item.title: End-to-End Machine Learning with AWS: Part 2
item.description: Previous: An introduction | Next: Setting up the development environment

item.title: End-to-End Machine Learning with AWS: Part 1
item.description: Yes, it’s ANOTHER goddamn “how to be a data scientist” blog post. Maybe it’s just the corner of the internet I tend to find myself in, but it seems like data science people love nothing more than telling other people how to start learning data science. Learn SQL. Come up with a personal project to work on. Practice coding interview questions, learn Pandas, study this flow chart of which ML algorithms to use for some reason.

item.title: End-to-End Machine Learning with AWS: Part 3
item.description: Things to install Poetry Official docs $ curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 - Try running poetry --version, if that doesn’t work you probably need to add to your PATH. Open ~/.bash_profile and add the line $ export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH" AWS CDK Official installation docs You will obviously need an AWS account first. Install node.js. This is required for the CDK libraries to work, regardless of the language you’ll actually be working in.
